did.unittitle: 70. A corner inside the home of a well-to-do Nepalese settler in southwestern Bhutan. The large brass pots on the top are used only for special feasts. Tin cans on the shelf contain food, spices, sugar, etc. Water is brought from the stream in large tin cans with handles (lower left), and is stored in big barrels for domestic use. Photographed at Honka.
